body.p:
Covington Ky June 24th 1862
To Hon B Magoffin
Governor of Ky

Your Petitioner would respectfully ask your honour to reprieve her She was Tried and convicted for stealing $12.50 from the drawn of his neighbours She states that she is but twelve years old and did not know it was felony but knows she done wrong She prays that your Exercise the Power that you possess and grant her reprieve & your Petitioner will ever pray

We the undersigned were on the Jury that found the above named Amanda M Linnell guilty and Say that we sentenced her for the shortest time we could to Wit one year in the Penetentiary, we join cheerfully in the prayr of the Petitioner and recommend the reprieve as she is the only daughter of a poor Ignorant widowed mother --

Names of Jurors
H C Halley
M. W. Graves
G. C. Tarvin
J B Lendrum
Jno MacKay
names of Jurors
J. M. Lohman
Thomas Hill
Wm Graham
We the undersigned Say that we believe the Statement in the foregoing Petition to be true and join asking you however to reprieve the unfortunate child

S. C. Perrin
A H Hood
A C Ellis
R Simmons
R A Athey
Jas. Pryor --
J G Carlisle Atty for Comth Pro Tem
James R. Hallam
John F. Fisk
Joe M Kennedy
The above names I think are Enough with the following certificate of the clerk to justify you in Pardong the Peitioner
N B Please direct to me

Kenton Circuit Court
June Term 1862
Commth
vs } Verdict
Amanda M Tinnell
We the Jury find the Defendent guilty and fix her punishment at one year in the Penetentiary and unanimously recommend her to Executive Clemency -- John Mackay foreman"
